medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient presents with pronounced myotonia and generalized muscle hypertrophy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in the neonatal period, including feeding difficulties and facial grimaces. By age 9, muscle hypertrophy was reported, with muscle stiffness and myotonia exacerbated by cold temperatures. At age 11, significant myotonia persisted, affecting various muscle groups with severe stiffness limiting daily activities.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was previously diagnosed with Schwartz-Jampel syndrome and had been treated with carbamazepine without clinical benefit. Genetic analysis indicated myotonic dystrophy type 1 (DM1) with a presence of CTG repeats and a new SCN4A mutation (p.P1158L).
medical_history.family_history: The father shows muscle stiffness, facial muscle weakness, ptosis, and myotonic symptoms, with diagnoses compatible with myotonic dystrophy type 1 confirmed by genetic analysis.
